entry.title: Combined summary - Ordinals BIP PR
entry.summary: The email exchange discusses the process of promoting draft proposals to Bitcoin Improvement Proposals (BIPs). The sender suggests that in an ideal world, proposers should be able to self-manage the promotion process, but acknowledges the need for BIP maintainers to moderate and protect the process. They also mention the possibility of changing the condition of "interactions" to "enough non-authors considering the proposal final" to encourage co-responsibility. Peter Todd questions the purpose of using numbers for BIPs if they are not memorable and suggests using names instead. The email proposes the use of an automated system to assign BIP numbers, eliminating subjective human elements. However, this may result in a significant increase in the BIP number space, which could be offset by starting the new numbering scheme at the highest manually assigned BIP number. The email also raises concerns about the personal opinions and biases of BIP editors affecting the merging of pull requests. The writer suggests limiting BIP assignment to widely used standards aligned with the core mission of Bitcoin and mentions Lightning as a positive alternative. Another participant agrees and argues that focusing too much on BIP numbers may lead to misinterpretations and potential problems. The participants in the conversation include Peter Todd, Léo Haf, and Andrew Poelstra, with their respective contact information provided.
